meanings.definition: Feeling or showing bitterness or resentment
meanings.sent1: She gave him a rancoured look after he betrayed her trust.
meanings.sent2: The rancoured expression on her face revealed her true feelings.
meanings.sent3: Despite her rancoured feelings, she tried to remain civil during the argument.
meanings.sent4: The rancoured atmosphere in the room was palpable, making everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The rancoured tone in her voice made it clear she was not ready to forgive.

meanings.sent1: His rancoured heart could not find peace after the betrayal.
meanings.sent2: The rancoured memories of the past haunted him every day.
meanings.sent3: The rancoured taste of the medicine made him cringe every time he had to take it.
meanings.sent4: The rancoured relationship between the two families seemed beyond repair.
meanings.sent5: The rancoured words spoken in anger could not be taken back.
